natural problem: Find the quotient when $7x^3 + 3x^2 - 5x - 8$ is divided by $x + 2.$
natural solution: The long division is shown below. \[ \begin{array}{c|cc cc} \multicolumn{2}{r}{7x^2} & -11x & +17  \\ \cline{2-5} x + 2 & 7x^3 & +3x^2&-5x&-8  \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{7x^3} & +14x^2& \\  \cline{2-3} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & -11x^2& -5x\\

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 7*x powr 3 + 3*x powr 2 - 5*x - 8"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x + 2"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x"
shows  "R x = 7*x powr 2 - 11*x + 17"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the quotient when $7x^3 + 3x^2 - 5x - 8$ is divided by $x + 2.$ The final Answer is 7x^2 - 11x + 17
 ### Proof
 The long division is shown below. \[ \begin{array}{c|cc cc} \multicolumn{2}{r}{7x^2} & -11x & +17  \\ \cline{2-5} x + 2 & 7x^3 & +3x^2&-5x&-8  \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{7x^3} & +14x^2& \\  \cline{2-3} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & -11x^2& -5x\\ 
 \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & -11x^2& -22x\\  \cline{3-4} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & +17x & -8 \\  \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & +17x & +34 \\  \cline{4-5} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & & -42 \\  \end{array} \]Thus, the quotient is $\boxed{7x^2 - 11x + 17}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 7*x powr 3 + 3*x powr 2 - 5*x - 8"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x + 2"
and h2 : "P x dvd Q x"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. P x = Q x * R x"
shows  "R x = 7*x powr 2 - 11*x + 17"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Given a function $P(x) = 7x^3 + 3x^2 - 5x - 8$ and another function $Q(x) = x + 2$ such that $P(x)$ divides $Q(x)$, find the function $R(x)$ such that $P(x) = Q(x) * R(x)$. The final answer is $R(x) = 7x^2 - 11x + 17$.
